title: Ticket #5914: 'if defined' cannot handle variables with numbers
description:
The following config fails: 

if defined JOB_ROUTER_SCHEDD2_POOL
SCHEDD_CRON_JOBLIST = GRATIA_CLEANUP
else
SCHEDD_CRON_JOBLIST = TEST
endif

With the following error: 

# condor_ce_config_val schedd_cron_joblist
Configuration Error Line 1 while reading config source /etc/condor-ce/config.d/03-gratia-cleanup.conf
defined JOB_ROUTER_SCHEDD2_POOL is not a valid if condition because complex conditionals are not supported

After discussing it with TJ, it seems to be a big in the variable string parsing to check if it's an expression rather than a variable.
remarks:
2016-Sep-21 14:55:57 by johnkn:
bug requires variables with both _ and numbers to reproduce - looks like it's been there forever.

2016-Sep-23 15:54:30 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: I approve this change.
check_ins: 2016-Sep-21 14:58   Check-in [49256]: Fix for #5914, config if defined reported error for valid variables if the had both _ and a digit. ===VersionHistory:Complete=== (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
creator: blin
